intro: Crepis bithynica, commonly known as the Bithynian hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to parts of Europe and the Middle East, often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a single head, surrounded by pale green bracts. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, with a distinct central vein. Crepis bithynica is typically found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in temperate climates.
